result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE must enroll and complete the Fresh Start Program, Ms Stanger must control all narcotics of DE's mother so DE has no access to these, DE will comply with all random drug testing from Fresh Start program, Chips case and the SD.  DE will pay all costs of tests.  All no contacts  previously ordered will remain, DE must follow the directions of Jeremy Jacobs.

Defendant Stephen A Schultz in court with attorney Stephen D. Willett.  Defendant Stephen A Schultz in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with  15CM103, 15CM108, 15CF121-Init App.  Waive reading of CC in 15CM103, 15CM108, enter plea's of NG.  15CF121-Waive reading of CC.  Set for PH 8-06-15 @ 3:00PM (15CF121) bond modification in 15CF100, 15CM103, 15CM108.  
15CF100-State calls Deputy Michael Majeskie, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Atty Willett.  Witness dismissed.  State calls Investigator Steve Gronski, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Cross by Defense,  State rests, Witness dismissed.  State moves for bind over.  Court will find probable cause exits, will bind over for JT.  Information filed will proceed to arraignment.  Waive reading of the information, enter plea's of NG to all counts.  Bond continues.
Plea of Not Guilty and demand for twelve person jury trial
